com.placement.alerts

Class Alerts

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.placement.alerts.Alerts
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class Alerts
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This servlet is used to register alerts. This is a low level api and one has to use these api's to perform registering of alerts alerts INPUT: The input to this is a series of USN's semicolon seperated There has to be a single message. The user also has to provide a date.And this date is to be provided as a part of the message. The date should also be given the following format 12-2-2014 => 12022014 Type 0 : set alerts Type >=1: delete alerts sample url query

    http://alert?type=0&usn=1pi10cs135;1pi10cs134&message=Intuit is comming at pesit. Stiphend is 30k;1122013

    Encoded URI http%3A%2F%2Falert%3Ftype%3D0%26usn%3D1pi10cs135%3B1pi10cs134%26message%3DIntuit%20is%20comming%20at%20pesit.%20Stiphend%20is%2030k%3B1122013 Very Very Important Note The response on successful setting of an alert returns a number that number is to be stored, incase you plan on deleting the alert in future. Please donot leave the usn and message blank in case of deleting. message=;DD-MM-YY usn=SOME10DIGITNUMBER
    Author:
    Varun V Shenoy
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • sendResponse

        private void sendResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse httpResponse,
                java.lang.String response)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used whenever one wants to say something to the user, ie the person who has sent a text message. It is strongly advised that you call this method no more than once in the entire servlet.(Not a requirement)
        Parameters:
        httpResponse - the response object sent by the servlet container
        response - the response text to be sent to the user, ie the person who has sent a text message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
